Articles.Content: On 40 minutes left in the launch window.
A bit of problems with the LH valves.
oh cool, they've got a drone in play to (hopefully) watch the splash down.

I asked eveyone available if they wanted to see the launch of the "Biggest Rocket Launch in 4 Years" (Technically true, the LES top is higher than a payload fairing), and i just want to sugarcoat it as much as possible. And no one cared. No one wanted to see it.

Do people just not like space exploration that much anymore?

Also, if it weren't for that damn boat we'd have launched by now. We didn't get wind problems until after the countdown timer would have progressed to engine lighting.

Just 30 minutes left in the launch window. We need to pick up the countdown timer in at most 25 minutes to launch in time.
Sheesh, I would have Hyperedited it by now...

Here is where you can talk about Orion!

It is currently having issues with the booster valves.

Watch it launch live here:

http://www.nasa.gov

It's on the front page.

May launch within 45 minutes or less!

I asked eveyone available if they wanted to see the launch of the "Biggest Rocket Launch in 4 Years" (Technically true, the LES top is higher than a payload fairing), and i just want to sugarcoat it as much as possible. And no one cared. No one wanted to see it.

Do people just not like space exploration that much anymore?

Also, if it weren't for that damn boat we'd have launched by now. We didn't get wind problems until after the countdown timer would have progressed to engine lighting.

I dunno, I had six (non-space nerd) people watching this with me before the launch started getting delayed.

I asked eveyone available if they wanted to see the launch of the "Biggest Rocket Launch in 4 Years" (Technically true, the LES top is higher than a payload fairing), and i just want to sugarcoat it as much as possible. And no one cared. No one wanted to see it.

Do people just not like space exploration that much anymore?

That's sad. Guess they think "seen one, seem 'em all", poor deluded fools!

but yeah, I messaged my friends too and they can't be bothered either, or they're at work. So glad I work from home!

That's sad. Guess they think "seen one, seem 'em all", poor deluded fools!

but yeah, I messaged my friends too and they can't be bothered either, or they're at work. So glad I work from home!

I don't think any of them have seen a real rocket launch aside from perhaps a few pictures of the Saturn V in elementary school.

Still standing by for the word on how the troubleshooting went.
Looks like I chose the wrong week to quit smoking.

Looks like I chose the wrong week to quit smoking.

Lol. is it too stressfull?
Looks like I chose the wrong week to quit drinking.

they're still trying to get those darn values to cycle! odd thing is, I've not seen a single engineer go out there and kick it!

oh lol, they just said they're going to disable the auto alarms and go manual on that! (go Jeb go!)

Most recent update from here (the time is off :/)

i think they just made a new T zero!!
They're into last-resort proceedings to try to recover the window; looks like I chose the wrong week to quit amphetamines.
Oooh, they have a new T-0 now. Trying one last attempt...! Hope hope hope hope hope.
